Definition: The DSP software or bitstream responsible for beamforming.
The DSP software or bitstream responsible for channelisation.
A correlator architecture where digitiser data is first channelised (F) per-receptor and then cross-correlation (X) is calculated per-frequency-channel.
The DSP software or bitstream responsible for correlation.
Pain In The Antechamber: a term commonly used when dicsussing the capabilities of Google Docs.
